summary:
11 years at Shell across technical projects and digital products. Motivated to provide digital solutions for better sustainable future. Delivered technical products including- Appstore, Energy project benchmarking analogue tool, basin modelling platform; SAFe POPM certified Product Manager/Owner. Domain skill-level expertise in core geosciences competencies such as WRFM, Static reservoir modelling, Reservoir Geology, seismic interpretation, Well planning and Operations, Well/field abandonment, Underground storage. Executed various integrated energy field projects across the globe including Brunei-Malaysia, Indonesia-Australia, Tanzania-Egypt, North Sea, UAE-Oman, Bolivia. A good communicator and able to engage stakeholders regularly meeting their requirement. Involved in Shell subsurface digital transformation journey. Strong willingness to learn and coach the younger generation.  

•	Product Management Competency: Product vision definition-execution, Agile Product Management, Business metrics, Commercialization, 
•	Product Owner Competency: Customer research, Design thinking, Change management, Information risk management, 
•	Data Science Competency: Data wrangling, Data visualization, Machine learning
•	Project Management Competency: Communication Skills, Stakeholder management, Collaboration, Project management

Product owner- Subsurface wells', 'title': 'Product Manager Subsurface Wells', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}, {'location': 'Assen, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'company': 'NAM BV Assen', 'description': 'Project Management (NAM OneGas)
•	Review of OneGas offshore fields based on latest VIR, project economics understanding; identify project funnel for post-2021 drilling sequence. Use of PowerBi for data visualization and communication.
Offshore North Sea Development (Caravel, UK)						           
•	Static modelling, structural interpretation for a structurally complex offshore field in North Sea, for a planned infill well for a gas field in offshore UK.
Offshore South North Sea Development (Ameland, L13FG)					  
•	Well planning for multiple offshore tight gas field in North Sea; well trajectory for shallow water Ameland field. This included pore pressure prediction, fracture pressure prediction integration, well design for horizontal/vertical wells, fraccing operations.
Automation of aeolian reservoir facies (Rotliegend)						      
•	Conceptualized and developing the algorithm to automate the identification of good quality reservoir facies foe Rotliegend reservoirs by application of machine learning and integrating regional dataset.

Offshore North Sea Well Planning and Development (L13, Groningen)				             July 2019-January 2020
•	Integrated reservoir modelling for offshore tight gas field development in North Sea
•	Conceptualized the Zechstein risking of the area by integrating seismic, offset well and pressure data to de-risk well.
•	Audited the major Groningen gas field as part of project wrap and knowledge sharing to external stakeholders.', 'title': 'Production Geologist Shell', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}, {'location': 'Spijkenisse, South Holland, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'company': 'NAM BV Assen', 'description': 'Wellsite Geologist
Well drilling Onshore Netherlands	(Spijkeniesse)					         	         February 2020-April 2020
•	Drilled successfully the last onshore exploration well for Shell Netherlands without NPT. This well added gas volumes to Barendrecht gas system. Delivered well site geologist support, mudlog preparation, well target depth calls.', 'title': 'Field Operations Supervisor', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': 1271, 'name': 'Shell', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQGN30g7aSl4NA/company-logo_400_400/0/1519856218579?e=1700092800&v=beta&t=HqIwwLBNmVKkXXiXnFVRbQwTX34PBz5TB2QZhtR3btU', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/shell/', 'employees': {'start': 10001, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Bengaluru, Karnataka', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'company': 'Shell', 'description': 'Well abandonment project- Bolivia                January 2019-May 2019
•	Systemized and delivered subsurface isolation and well abandonment of strategy for five fields in Bolivia. This included pore pressure prediction, fracture pressure prediction integration, detailed well abandonment. 
Egypt Offshore Study               	 January 2018-December 2018 
•	Re-evaluated the volumetrics of the Notus field based on reworked channel architecture and updated velocity model. This enabled the asset team to decide on the maturation of the project. 
UK Tanzania Equity Redetermination Study			   April 2017-December 2017
•	Built fit-for-purpose structural model of the complex deepwater turbidites and mass transport complex fields.
•	Validated in-place gas volumes, well count and possible risks associated. This work was part of Shell-BG acquisition.
Brunei Low Cost Development Project                            	August 2015 – April 2017
•	Catalogued reservoir characterization, uncertainty-risk analysis and volume estimation. This study had a direct impact in business-critical decision of not making further time and money investment in the field, which was critical for the project, through fit-for-purpose modelling by capturing the uncertainties in detail using seismic associated with the volumes. 
Egypt field property evaluation study                       		  May 2015 – July 2015
•	Reinforced an alternate facies and property model using Petrel and the impact of using different facies and property on the field volumetrics. 
Middle-east carbonate fields (UAE, Iraq)        	       		     February 2015 - May 2015
•	Audited operator carbonate static model; well proposal for carbonate wells
Indonesian Mega-gas field development (Abadi Field)                 	    	         July 2014 – February 2015
•	Audited static model of Shell and INPEX of the giant undeveloped gas/condensate field which was part of the Shell view of the optimum feasible concept of the field.', 'title': 'Production Geoscientist', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}, {'location': 'Bengaluru, Karnataka', 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'company': 'Shell', 'description': 'Brunei field opportunity screening study (Champion Sliver Field)             		   	     September 2013 – June 2014
•	Quantified discovered volumes and quantitatively analysed undiscovered volumes potential with limited data, through detailed uncertainty analysis. Seismic interpretation including horizon-fault picks, well to seismic tie structural reconstruction and use of strat 3D to explain the complex structural evolution.
•	My working relationship with the client and involving global expert was highly appreciated by BSP and was recognized.
Central North Sea field development study (Belinda-Evelyn fields)             		 	     January 2013 – January 2014
•	Pre-DG2 feasibility evaluation of Evelyn and Belinda accumulation with potential Gannet asset tie-up. This was done by me through a detailed full-field and sector model based on a conceptual depositional model for thin-bedded turbidite deposits. Seismic interpretation and well to seismic tie and detailed modelling.
•	Built a good relationship with the turbidite research team and SME on Structural systems which aided in working across interdisciplinary boundaries and time-zones. This led to gaining new insights on thin-bed turbidites and in solving the issue surrounding the modelling of thin-bed turbidites. Part of 3D close-the-loop study.
Brunei-Malaysia Deeper reservoir study (Fairley Baram Field)                     		  	      August 2012 – January 2013
•	Quantified the volume potential of the deeper unpenetrated appraisal targets based on the first-ever stratigraphic framework built for the whole Fairley Baram field by integrating seismic-log-analogue data. Predictions were successfully confirmed by the drilled well.', 'title': 'Production Geologist', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}]}]
